q: Which clause is used for window functions?
What is the output of this query?
c: SELECT ROW_NUMBER() OVER (ORDER BY id) FROM t LIMIT 1;

q: ROW_NUMBER() assigns sequential integers to rows.
The ______ function divides rows into groups.
What is the output of this query?
c: SELECT RANK() OVER (ORDER BY score DESC) FROM (SELECT 100 as score UNION ALL SELECT 100) t LIMIT 1;

q: What is the output of this query?
c: SELECT LEAD(val) OVER (ORDER BY id) FROM (SELECT 1 as id, 10 as val UNION ALL SELECT 2, 20) t LIMIT 1;

q: PARTITION BY is similar to GROUP BY for windows.
What is the output of this query?
c: SELECT SUM(val) OVER () FROM (SELECT 10 as val UNION ALL SELECT 20) t LIMIT 1;

q: Which function returns first value in partition?
What is the output of this query?
c: SELECT LAST_VALUE(val) OVER (ORDER BY id ROWS BETWEEN UNBOUNDED PRECEDING AND UNBOUNDED FOLLOWING) FROM (SELECT 1 as id, 10 as val UNION ALL SELECT 2, 20) t LIMIT 1;

q: What is the output of this query?
c: SELECT PERCENT_RANK() OVER (ORDER BY val) FROM (SELECT 10 as val UNION ALL SELECT 20 UNION ALL SELECT 30) t LIMIT 1;

q: UNBOUNDED PRECEDING means from first row.
What is the output of this query?
c: SELECT NTH_VALUE(val, 2) OVER (ORDER BY id) FROM (SELECT 1 as id, 10 as val UNION ALL SELECT 2, 20) t WHERE id = 2;

q: The ______ frame type uses logical ranges.
What is the output of this query?
c: WITH t AS (SELECT 1 as n) SELECT n FROM t;

q: CTE stands for Common Table Expression.
What is the output of this query?
c: WITH RECURSIVE cnt(n) AS (SELECT 1 UNION ALL SELECT n+1 FROM cnt WHERE n < 3) SELECT MAX(n) FROM cnt;

q: What is the output of this query?
c: WITH a AS (SELECT 1 as x), b AS (SELECT 2 as y) SELECT x + y FROM a, b;

q: The ______ query is the base case in recursion.
Which operator combines sets without duplicates?
What is the output of this query?
Which operator returns rows not in second set?
What is the output of this query?
What is the output of this query?
c: SELECT CASE WHEN 1=1 THEN 'yes' ELSE 'no' END;

q: Which function returns first non-null value?
What is the output of this query?
NULLIF returns NULL if values are equal.
The ______ function replaces NULL with a value.
What is the output of this query?
c: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM (SELECT 1 UNION ALL SELECT 2) t HAVING COUNT(*) > 1;

q: The ______ clause groups rows for aggregation.
What is the output of this query?
c: SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT val) FROM (SELECT 1 as val UNION ALL SELECT 1 UNION ALL SELECT 2) t;

q: The ______ function generates all group combinations.
What is the output of this query?
c: SELECT GROUPING(a) FROM (SELECT 1 as a) t GROUP BY ROLLUP(a) LIMIT 1;

q: The ______ statement shows query execution plan.
Which index type is best for equality searches?
Indexes speed up SELECT but slow INSERT.
What is the output of this query?
c: CREATE INDEX idx ON t(col); SELECT 'done';

q: The ______ index covers all query columns.
Which join type returns all rows from both tables?
What is the output of this query?
c: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM (SELECT 1 as a) x CROSS JOIN (SELECT 1 as b UNION ALL SELECT 2) y;

q: Match the join types with behavior:
The ______ join returns only matching rows.
What is the output of this query?
c: SELECT * FROM (SELECT 1 as id) a NATURAL JOIN (SELECT 1 as id) b;

q: NATURAL JOIN matches columns by name.
What is the output of this query?
Correlated subqueries run once per outer row.
The ______ keyword checks for subquery results.
Which operator compares to any subquery value?
What is the output of this query?
The ______ keyword specifies all values must match.
Which clause creates a derived table?
What is the output of this query?
The ______ join references the outer query.
What is the output of this query?
What is the output of this query?
SUBSTRING extracts part of a string.
What is the output of this query?
What is the output of this query?
What is the output of this query?
Which data type stores date and time?
What is the output of this query?
What is the output of this query?
c: CREATE PROCEDURE p() BEGIN SELECT 1; END; CALL p();

q: What is the output of this query?
What is the output of this query?
c: DECLARE cur CURSOR FOR SELECT 1; OPEN cur; FETCH cur INTO @v; SELECT @v;

q: What is the output of this query?
c: CREATE TRIGGER t BEFORE INSERT ON tbl FOR EACH ROW SET NEW.col = 1; SELECT 'done';

q: Triggers can cascade to other triggers.
What is the output of this query?
c: CREATE SEQUENCE seq START 1; SELECT NEXTVAL('seq');

q: PRIMARY KEY combines UNIQUE and NOT NULL.
What is the output of this query?
c: CREATE TABLE t(id INT PRIMARY KEY, val INT CHECK(val > 0)); SELECT 'done';

q: Which action sets null on delete?
What is the output of this query?
c: CREATE VIEW v AS SELECT 1 as n; SELECT n FROM v;

q: Which index type is best for text search?
What is the output of this query?
c: CREATE INDEX idx ON t(col); DROP INDEX idx; SELECT 'done';

q: The ______ index stores data in sorted order.
Query optimizer uses statistics for planning.
What is the output of this query?
c: CREATE TABLE t(id INT) PARTITION BY RANGE(id) (PARTITION p0 VALUES LESS THAN (100)); SELECT 'done';

q: Which join algorithm uses hash tables?
What is the output of this query?
Which isolation level prevents dirty reads?
What is the output of this query?
c: BEGIN; INSERT INTO t VALUES(1); ROLLBACK; SELECT COUNT(*) FROM t;

q: What is the output of this query?
c: CREATE USER u WITH PASSWORD 'pass'; SELECT 'done';

q: Which SQL type injects dynamic values?
What is the output of this query?
c: PREPARE stmt FROM 'SELECT ?'; EXECUTE stmt USING @val;

q: What is the output of this query?
JSON data type stores structured data.
What is the output of this query?
What is the output of this query?
What is the output of this query?
What is the output of this query?
What is the output of this query?
c: SELECT * FROM t FOR SYSTEM_TIME AS OF '2023-01-01' LIMIT 1;

q: What is the output of this query?
c: SELECT STDDEV(val) FROM (SELECT 10 as val UNION ALL SELECT 20) t;

q: What is the output of this query?
c: SELECT LISTAGG(val, ',') WITHIN GROUP (ORDER BY val) FROM (SELECT 'a' as val UNION ALL SELECT 'b') t;

q: The ______ prevents infinite loops in hierarchies.
Which clause handles cycles in recursion?
What is the output of this query?
c: WITH RECURSIVE t AS (SELECT 1 n UNION ALL SELECT n+1 FROM t WHERE n<3) SELECT MAX(n) FROM t;

q: BREADTH FIRST visits level by level.
What is the output of this query?
c: SELECT /*+ INDEX(t idx) */ * FROM t WHERE col = 1;
